etymology.description: Pictogram: a drum 口 with two ends and a base, with feathers 土 on top; in 鼓 a hand holding a stick is also visible; compare the bottom of 豊.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an ancient drum mounted on a stand, with the shell (口), endcaps, and base, topped by decorative plumes (土). In extended forms like 鼓, a hand and stick are added to show the act of striking the drum.

examples.chinese: 壴为象形字，表示架上的鼓(壴為象形字，表示架上的鼓)。
examples.pinyin: Zhù wéi xiàngxíngzì, biǎoshì jià shàng de gǔ.
examples.english: Zhù is a pictograph representing a drum on a stand.

examples.chinese: 在古籍中，壴多指礼乐所用之鼓(在古籍中，壴多指禮樂所用之鼓)。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔjí zhōng, zhù duō zhǐ lǐyuè suǒ yòng zhī gǔ.
examples.english: In ancient texts, zhù often refers to drums used in ritual music.

examples.chinese: 字形中可见口与土的要素，构成鼓的形象(字形中可見口與土的要素，構成鼓的形象)。
examples.pinyin: Zìxíng zhōng kě jiàn kǒu yǔ tǔ de yàosù, gòuchéng gǔ de xíngxiàng.
examples.english: The form shows the elements 口 and 土 combining to depict a drum.
